name: src/backend/index.js
Backend
description: Backend abstract class.
examples:
<caption>Custom backend implementation</caption>
class MyBackend extends Backend {
  constructor(transport) {
    this._transport = transport.on('data', this._recvMsg.bind(this));
  }

  _recvMsg(message) {
    const id = ... // determine request id
    const result = ... // process message
    this.onResult(id, result);
  }

  // `command` is passed by the method handler, e.g. `xCommand()`.
  send(id, command) {
    const message = ... // use id and command to construct message
    this._transport.send(message);
  }

  // this is dispatched by .execute()
  'xCommand()'(request, send) {
    const command = ... // do stuff with request
    return send(command).then(result => {
      // process result
    });
  }
}

name: close
description:
Close the backend connection and free up resources. The backend should not
be used after it is closed and a new instance is required in order
re-initialize.

name: isReady
description: Promise that is resolved once the backend is ready to receive commands.

return.description: Promised resolved when the backend is ready.

name: defaultHandler
description:
Default method handler. Called if there isn't a handler specified for the
method type. The default handler dies unless it is overridden in a sub-class.

params.name: send
params.description: Function for dispatching the request to the backend service.

name: getRequestType
description:
Determine the type of the JSON-RPC request. The type is used for
dispatching the request to the different rpc handlers. Sub-classes may
override this for custom routing behavior.

name: execute
description:
Transmit the given JSON-RPC payload to the backend service. The request
type is determined using {@link getRequestType} and the request is
delegated to method handlers, if they are defined for the given type. The
default handler ({@link defaultHandler}) is used if there is no handler
for the request type.

Method handlers are defined on the sub-class, using the naming convention of
`<requestType>()` (notice the '()' suffix). Method handlers are passed the
request object and a `send` function to invoke for the request.

params.name: request
params.description: JSON-RPC request to execute agains the backend service.

return.description: Promise resolved when response is received.

name: onFeedback
description: Called when receiving feedback from the backend service.

params.name: result
params.description: JSON-RPC params data for the feedback event.

name: onResult
description:
Called when the backend is done processing the response and ready to hand
it over to the XAPI frontend. The response should be a valid JSON-RPC
response.

params.name: id
params.description: Request id of the JSON-RPC request.

name: send
description:
Used to send the actual command to the backend service. The command
should be generated by the method handler and .

name: src/backend/tsh.js
TSHBackend
description: Backend to communicate with a {@link Duplex} stream talking tshell (tsh).

name: src/backend/ws.js
WSBackend
description:
Backend to communicate with a WebSocket server.

This backend expects to talk directly to a JSON-RPC WebSocket backend.
Authentication has to be handled by the transport layer, there is no
support for that on the socket itself.

Once the socket is open, it is expected to be in the ready state.

params.name: urlOrWS
params.description: WebSocket object or URL of the server.

name: src/cli.js
src/index.js
connect
description: Connect to an XAPI endpoint.

params.name: options.username
params.description: Username to authenticate with if protocol requires authentication.

params.name: options.password
params.description: Password to authenticate with if protocol requires authentication.

return.description: XAPI interface connected to the given URI.

name: src/json-parser.js
JSONParser
description: Streaming JSON parser. Implements the Node.js {@link Duplex} stream API.

name: parseJSON
description: Synchronous frontend to {@link JSONparser}.

name: src/log.js
src/transport/ssh.js
connectSSH
description: Creates a {@link Duplex} SSH stream.

params.name: options.command
params.description: If command is specified, it is executed on the remote host instead of a login shell.

name: src/transport/stream.js
StreamTransport
description:
Duplex stream transport for integrations where JSXAPI does not have direct
access to the network or local ipc. E.g. for sandboxing or test stubs.

name: constructor
description: Creates a {@link Duplex} stream.

name: close
description: Closes the stream transport

params.name: data
params.description: Push inbound data from the XAPI service to JSXAPI.

return.description: Boolean signaling if the stream can receive more data.

name: src/transport/tsh.js
spawnTSH
description: Use the TSH binary to connect to a TSH server.

name: src/xapi/components.js
Component
description: Common base class for XAPI section types (commands, configs, events, statuses).

name: prefix
description: Prefix to add to all paths for the component.

name: normalizePath
description: Normalizes a path including the component prefix.

name: Config
description: Interface to XAPI configurations.

name: Event
description: Interface to XAPI events.

name: Status
description: Interface to XAPI statuses.

name: src/xapi/exc.js
src/xapi/feedback.js
FeedbackGroup
description: Group feedback deregister handlers for bookkeeping.

name: add
description: Add a deregister handler function to the feedback group.

params.name: handler
params.description: Handler to add to the group.

name: remove
description: Remove a deregister handler function from the feedback group.

params.name: handler
params.description: Handler to remove from the group.

name: off
description: Call the deregister handler functions associated with this group.

name: Feedback
description: Feedback handler for the XAPI.
examples:
<caption>Register a feedback listener</caption>
xapi.feedback.on('Status/Audio/Volume', data => {
  console.log(`Received feedback data: ${data}`);
});

<caption>Get the feedback root payload</caption>
xapi.feedback.on('Status/Audio/Volume', (data, payload) => {
  console.log(`System volume changed to: ${data}`);
  JSON.stringify(payload) // => { Status: { Audio: { Volume: data } } }
});

<caption>Listen to array elements</caption>
xapi.feedback.on('Status/Call[42]/Status', callStatus => {
  console.log(`Call status for call number 42 is: ${callStatus}`);
});

<caption>Bundle feedback listeners for easy unsubscription</caption>
const feedbackGroup = xapi.feedback.group([
  xapi.status.on('Audio/Volume', volumeListener),
  xapi.status.on('Call', callListener),
]);

// Disable feedback listening for all listeners of the group.
feedbackGroup.off();

<caption>Register listener with Array path</caption>
const off = xapi.feedback.on('Status/Audio/Volume', listener);
off(); // De-register feedback

name: on
description:
Registers a feedback listener with the backend service which is invoked
when there is feedback matching the subscription query.

name: once
description:
Registers a feedback listener similar to {@link on}, but the subscription
is removed after the first invocation of the listener.

name: off
description: Remove feedback registration.
deprecated: use deactivation handler from `.on()` and `.once()` instead.

name: dispatch
description: Dispatches feedback data to the registered handlers.

params.name: data
params.description: JSON data structure of feedback data.

name: group
description:
Creates a grouper object which tracks which tracks the feedback paths and
listeners being added to it.
examples:
<caption>Bundle feedback listeners for easy unsubscription</caption>
// Create a group
const group = xapi.feedback.group([
  xapi.status.on('Audio Volume', (volume) => {
    // ...
  }),
  xapi.config.on('Audio DefaultVolume', (volume) => {
    // ...
  }),
]);

const handler = xapi.status.on('Call', (call) => { ... });

// Add handler to the group
group.add(handler);

// Remove handler from the group
group.remove(handler);

// Unregister from all feedback handlers
group.off();

name: src/xapi/index.js
XAPI
description:
User-facing API towards the XAPI. Requires a backend for communicating
with an XAPI instance. It should be possible to write backends for all kinds
of transports (TSH over SSH, Websockets, HTTP, plain sockets, etc.)
examples:
<caption>Listen to an event</caption>
xapi.event.on('Some Event Name', (data) => {
  console.log(`Received feedback data: ${data}`);
});

params.name: backend
params.description: Backend connected to an XAPI instance.

name: feedback
description: Interface to XAPI feedback registration.

name: config
description: Interface to XAPI configurations.

name: event
description: Interface to XAPI events.

name: status
description: Interface to XAPI statuses.

name: close
description: Close the XAPI connection.

name: command
description: Executes the command specified by the given path.

params.name: body
params.description: Multi-line body for commands requiring it.

return.description: Resolved with the command response when ready.

name: execute
description: Execute the given JSON-RPC request on the backend.

params.name: method
params.description: Name of RPC method to invoke.

params.name: params
params.description: Parameters to add to the request.

name: src/xapi/mixins.js
Listenable
description: Mixin for XAPI sections that can trigger feedback.

name: on
description: Register a new listener on the given path.

return.description: Handler to deregister the feedback registration.

name: once
description:
Register a new listener on the given path, de-register
after the first change happened.

return.description: Handler to deregister the feedback registration.

name: off
description: De-register the given listener on the given path.
deprecated: use deactivation handler from `.on()` and `.once()` instead.

name: Gettable
description: Mixin for XAPI sections that can hold a value that may be fetched.

name: get
description: Gets the value of the given path.

return.description: Resolved to the configuration value when ready.

name: Settable
description: Mixin for XAPI sections that can hold a value that may be fetched.

name: set
description: Sets the path to the given value.

return.description: Resolved to the status value when ready.

name: mix
description: Extend {Base} class and apply {Mixins}.

return.description: Object - New ad-hoc base class with mixins applied.

name: src/xapi/normalizePath.js
normalizePath
description:
Normalizes a path by turning it into an Array of strings.
Removes empty parts of the path and ignores redundant whitespace or
slashes. Each path element is also capitalized.

params.name: path
params.description: Array or string path to normalize.
